title: Hebrew Quark XT?
content:
Is there a Quark XT for Hebrew layouts? I created a booklet in Quark 6 in English that's being translated into Hebrew. I found out that Hebrew is the exact opposite of English--it's read right to left and books are front to back. Is there an extension for Quark that can flow text in this manner? I've seen a post regarding Arabic, which is apparently similar, but, from what I gather, it seems the extension doesn't work that well. Is anyone familiar with a Hebrew extension?

 [‹ Need to find articles on Arthur Baker](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605055157/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14276 "Go to previous forum topic") [Hiragino Mincho Pro - PC version? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605055157/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14564 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jhdesign

comments.content: open it in InDesign ME and then you’ll be able to reverse the layout and put in Hebrew.

The last version of Quark to support Hebrew was 4 (and you had to get the more expensive “Passport” version.) But InDesign ME offers better Hebrew support than Quark ever had. If all you need is a single booklet, there’s a [30 day trial version available for download](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605055157/http:/www.winsoft.fr/products/download/DownloadsME.html).
